Reviews.Title: QSU2DVR04  sucks, and q-see tech support too.
Reviews.Author: R. Mendoza "Pele"
Reviews.Content: Hi, I bought this USB DVR because it has two audio channels, so it is supposed to record audio, but this feature is NOT true!!! This DVR really sucks and Q-See tech support is really POOR, I have been calling for three days and they never answer. Please don't waste your money on this poor DVR and buy a real one.

Reviews.Title: Not for Vista at this time
Reviews.Author: night watcher
Reviews.Content: That is what I was told by a service tech, after I purchased the unit, and after I spent many hours trying to get the product to work. It's not mentioned anywhere in the product information either.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Henry Goodison "jack man"
Reviews.Content: This product is easy to use.  Install software, plug into usb port, attach cameras and your'e ready to go.  I didn't want an expensive dvr system and this was perfect.

Reviews.Title: QSDT4PCRC
Reviews.Author: Ronald
Reviews.Content: Errors on dedicated write drive partition every reboot, inexplicable resource error issues, schedule config crashes, must reinnstall, no software updates available, cant even find QSDT4pcrc in support area. Wrong product choice and company.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY FOR X64 OR W7
Reviews.Author: grey hat brat
Reviews.Content: SCREW QSEE I have the same usb dvr... I upgraded to w7 x86. and no luck. I tried running in compatibility mode for all versions of windows.... I tried setting up windows xp mode... I trided using parallels AND oracle. I tried running it on an old laptop, but it wont let me save to a network path to my desktop...not even a mapped network drive. the vms dont work because of the "virtual video adapter" I cant install the driver for my video card because of this reason too. the support is the worst i have ever dealt with. I am currently dual booting w7 and vista... but I would like to somehow be able to load my vista partition while running windows.. is this possible? Is there a way to mod the firmare? is there software compatible with this 4 channel usb dvr??? CAN THE DAMN PEOPLE AT QSEE JUST POST A PATCH ALREADY?!??!?  worked great when I had vista tho... but I will not return to vista because of 1 piece of hardware.

Reviews.Title: Video Recorder adapter
Reviews.Author: Kenneth Peter Watkins "kenwat"
Reviews.Content: Works well after contacting tech support to open ports for e-mail notification.Narrow field of view if not mounted high enough.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good, considering the price...
Reviews.Author: Michael D. Messer
Reviews.Content: I bought this device about 9 months ago, to enable me to use my Dell PC for home security monitoring.  I started with a single camera and added a 2nd camera a few months ago.So far, the thing has worked very well.  I have it on mostly when I'm away from the house, but have been leaving it on at night a lot, especially on weekends.  No major problems so far.  Sometimes I get static & jumping in the video, but I think that's more from the camera wire runs than from the DVR device.Having 2 cameras DOES slow down the recording on each...  the playback is a lot choppier, but for security, it is fine.The motion-sensing is pretty good.  I do get a lot of hits due to insects flying around the cameras at night, and sometimes the daytime recordings have hits that I can't see any cause for, but all in all, it works well.  I've played with the sensitivity and if I have it low enough to eliminate a lot of false hits, it misses big stuff too.I've never been able to configure the e-mail notification, but wouldn't really want that, considering the false alarms.  I do use the remote viewing and it is pretty good, once you figure it out.I recommend the product to anyone needing inexpensive home security video.

Reviews.Title: Security Cam
Reviews.Author: Black Eyes "Frosed"
Reviews.Content: Worked as expected. I am very satisfied. I will buy another, maybe several. Someday I would like to find one that allows video input and output via usb, (mac and pc compatible)(low cost of course).

Reviews.Title: bad equipment
Reviews.Author: Stephen Herman
Reviews.Content: The cd it came with was blank.The instruction were a reduced copy the size of business card.

Reviews.Title: **DO NOT BUY THIS!!!*
Reviews.Author: B. Moon
Reviews.Content: I bought this before reading reviews. After I made my purchase, the reviews scared me then I thought, oh well, this is just a select few who had issues.  NO! They were spot on!  Unit apparently comes from a teenager who lives with parents trying to rip people off! Generic CD ("RiDATA"), from Wal-Mart, no labels, etc. and something that Windows simply cannot recognize on not one but THREE (3) different machines!  Plugged the actual unit into all 3 machines, same error message: "A USB unit has exceeded it power limits of the port hub." ...and that's just the barebones unit plugged in with NOTHING attached!!Need I say more?

Reviews.Title: Created for tech wizards
Reviews.Author: Richard Sommer
Reviews.Content: If you can make this function, you must have a great tech mind. Takes hours to get the basic functions to work. Never did get remote viewing to work. The documentation was written by persons who have never used it.

Reviews.Title: Will NOT work with Windows 7
Reviews.Author: D. Wilson
Reviews.Content: SuperDVR software will not work with Windows 7 of any version.  Customer support said that they will not work on a new driver until official release and that they are expecting March 2010.  This is a poor way to run a company.  My camera system has been rendered useless by no driver for this dvr.  Customer support was abrupt and obviously not looking out for their customers after the sale.

Reviews.Title: Doesn't work
Reviews.Author: Drei_Katzen "dreikatzen2004"
Reviews.Content: After owning a q-see camera for nine months, I was ready to expand my system. I really wanted this to work. The first thing I did was try to install the software. The disk could not be read, it didn't look like anything was even burned onto it and none of my drives could read either shiny non-marked side.  So I downloaded the software from the internet and after a few more frustrations with that, finally got it installed.  Then I hooked up my q-see cameras and it kept giving me a camera failure signal on everything. So I hooked up the q-see cameras I bought some time ago and had in use, no luck.It's junk. Save your money and your time. Up until now I have been happy with q-see, but the new cameras I bought from them show an obvious decline in quality from the ones I bought last year.  I'm sending it all back for a refund.

Reviews.Title: Works
Reviews.Author: Earl Willey
Reviews.Content: It works. The software is really outdated, and it apparently can't fast forward. To view it over the internet it looks really bad, and you have to install a software program on the computer you are using to view it over the internet. On top of that you have to change some setting in IE because it can't verify the creator. The software also does not open properly when viewing your settings. The video looks fine, but if you go into settings half of the boxes are missing or cut short. The product does works, and is perfect for anyone that has a old computer, and wants a cheap security system. I'm running it on XP, so I don't know if it works on vista.

Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: Jose Pena
Reviews.Content: This product is same as described in purchase. Delivery was very quickly and good conditions. I recommend this product and provider. Sincerely. Jose Pena

Reviews.Title: OVERVIEW OF QSEE USB DVR
Reviews.Author: Wayne M. Inlay
Reviews.Content: I have had the QSee USB DVR for almost a month.  It is a very sophisticated and a well matured product.  I installed the program and hooked up the USB DVR and 4 cameras to my laptop, everything worked as advertised.  This replaced a one video channel dvr which was basically useless for more than one camera.  The QSee USB DVR is great for laptops, the software is well designed and functional.  Very easy to understand and use.  I haven't had to refer to the manual yet.  I HIGHLY RECOMMEND the QSee USB DVR to anyone that needs  to use a USB device.  This is a GREAT product, with Great Value a bonus.

ProductInfo.Features:
Display/Record at 120/30 FPS (Total)
Video compression format: MPEG4.
Support remote surveillance and PTZ control through web browser
Software Included for Internet Monitoring / Networking
Input Connector: RCA
ProductInfo.Name: Q-See QSU2DVR04 4 Channel USB 2.0 Digital Video Recorder Adapter
